unit.utterance_translation: There are no family names before.
For example, if [you find a nice] woman,
[if] I find the one I love,
You will do to Father, "Dad!"
That I love that woman.

unit.utterance: Saddya, angindi, umangayde:tid ta ama na buka:gan.
unit.utterance_translation: Then, they go, they go to the father of the woman.
And they talked with each other.
But as for me,

unit.utterance: maski ballan na buka:gan, amma daddu:pu i nangibud,
unit.utterance_translation: even (I) am not loved by the woman, if a old man said,

unit.utterance: Panga:nan na Ilokano, a wa, "Kayatmu ket saan, agasawata latta."
unit.utterance_translation: In Ilokano, "even if you do not want to marry, just marry!"
So it is very bad before.

unit.utterance: Uman na bini:lid i buka:gani a wa asawa.
unit.utterance_translation: It is as if they commanded the wife.
even if he is ugly, even if he is bad,

unit.utterance: Amma saya i kabbat didi daddu:pu:i.
unit.utterance_translation: if it is what the old men want.
if you do not want what they want,
if they do not kill you, they will drive you away.
It is hard time.
we had an arrival there.

unit.utterance: Me''a:du barka:dami da awanamitep ta asawa.
unit.utterance_translation: We had a lot of friends because we had not married.
One is Kalengleng [i.e. Arsenyo]
and Onged,
and me.
and Ombes.
When we go hunting,

unit.utterance: Amma mamurabami, tamite: ti Kalènglèngi wa a Arsenyo a pa:ngibunbu:lun.
unit.utterance_translation: If we go hunting, It is only Kalengleng and me who go together.
if you catch a wild pig,
then we cut (the wild pig) into two for each other, then we hold it
If the others get a wild pig, they left us.
That guy says,

unit.utterance: "Ata'ay a munatina i uga:li didi toptay?"
unit.utterance_translation: Why is our companions's personality like that?
I do not know.
and he says,
"shall we leave here!"
"Let's go"
When we left them,
"you see, we left there."
We left them.
because they did not pay attention to us. [tangaw "asikasu"]
Kalengleng says,

unit.utterance: Awanitatine: mandi:ma da attanan a bukarot ta kinuma:man i wagèt.
unit.utterance_translation: We do not walk/swim there, because there are crocodiles since the water is flooded.

unit.utterance: Husto husto a lumanguyami ti wagètay,
unit.utterance_translation: We carefully/correctly swim in the river.
and the depth has come.

unit.utterance: Saya iwanami ti linumtaw i way bukarot.
unit.utterance_translation: Timpaw nga buwaya.

unit.utterance: Atti: ti wagèti, uman na wa, basikut.
Digdiganmi tiddya attanan didi amami, konta awande:tèn ta ama. Nappatid ti ama.
unit.utterance_translation: We, all of those, has arrived in our fathers, but [note that] I did not have my father [because] my father was dead.

unit.utterance: Manga:na i inakuti "Akkadi:! A:nu ngam dinumama ti wagèti, attanan na bukarot wagèti.
unit.utterance_translation: My mother said, "Oh no, why did you come across the river, where many crocodiles are in the water!"
It is good because you are not biten.
(it might) bite!" She said.
"Good that it did not bite you."
That normally bites you.
No! (We were not biten) antie.

unit.utterance: Saya i barka:daku ta dutul a awandèn mangginaginan.
unit.utterance_translation: That is my friend in my childhood [lit. before] who never left me.
But as for the others,
They do not have that (sort of kindness).

unit.utterance: Sigu:ro me:ke:ko malu:tèp, makano:notde:tèn ta historiaku.
unit.utterance_translation: Probably at night later on, I can recall my stories.
